intro: Codonoboea sallehuddiniana, commonly known as the Sallehuddin's codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories, preferring nutrient-rich soil. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
